channel.title: Using MIDI foot switches to select presets?
channel.description: Hey all, I want to use my Axoloti in a more live setting and don't want to have to bring a computer up on stage with me. Has anyone messed with the idea of using MIDI foot switches (ex. Keith McMillen 12 Step) to select between presets on the Axoloti? I haven't seen any posts or info about it, from what I can tell the presets are only accessible via computer. Any and all help would be greatly appreciated, just want to know before I go out and spend some more money on a midi controller. :slight_smile:

item.title: Using MIDI foot switches to select presets?
item.dc:creator: @keyman Antonio Machado
item.description:
@keyman wrote:

My working example @BadKidsToTheFront

Patch Bank and Midi Program change Your Music/Projects
Just a proof of concept working :wink: SoftStep sending MIDI program change to Axoloti 1.0.7 Patch Bank this to Controller object, create a Patch Bank, add patches to it and upload to SD card that's it !! [image] oldies...iPad 1 - S1MIDI Trigger - Line6 Mobilizer sending MIDI program change and notes

Read full topic

I have it working fine with the Keith McMillan Softstep (v1)

item.source: Using MIDI foot switches to select presets?

item.title: Using MIDI foot switches to select presets?
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

Looks like the McMillen 12 Step is MIDI Class compliant, so it should work with Axoloti. But better test it before buying an expensive controller like that.

Presets are available on the Axoloti board as well. Screenshot below shows how an incoming midi cc message can trigger a counter and select a new preset.

Read full topic
item.source: Using MIDI foot switches to select presets?
